meanings.definition: No longer in fashion or use; outdated.
meanings.sent1: Her outmoded phone could not even connect to the internet.
meanings.sent2: The outmoded computer system was replaced with a more efficient one.
meanings.sent3: His outmoded fashion sense made him stand out at the party.
meanings.sent4: The outmoded traditions of the past clashed with modern values.
meanings.sent5: The outmoded car sputtered and coughed, struggling to keep up with traffic.

meanings.definition: To make something old-fashioned or obsolete.
meanings.sent1: She outmoded her wardrobe by donating all her outdated clothes.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to outmode their manual processes with automated ones.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly outmoded his friend's taste in music by playing a vinyl record.
meanings.sent4: The new technology quickly outmoded the previous models on the market.
meanings.sent5: The young inventor hoped to outmode traditional thinking with his groundbreaking invention.
